Introduction to Locations

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the way that Locations are used to
control navigation in the user interface

¢ List the different types of Locations

¢ Modify widgets so that they navigate to given
Locations

| Locations

——_——_,

| Widget
—_—__

¢« ALocation is a PCF element that a
user can navigate to

« Locations themselves do not define
any visual content, but they can
contain Screen container(s) that do

¢ Locations can use system permissions
to control what the users can
see/access in the application

* Pages are used exclusively within Location Groups

original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Business requirement G

A business partner wants to make the Assigned User field navigable, so when a user
with the appropriate permissions (for example, Contact Administrator) logs in and
clicks on the name of the contact, the system opens a popup and the user can easily
see the user details and/or make changes.

G

Sooo ooo ooo ooo ooo

,~ — Of the seven types of Locations listed...
For each Location, what method would you usually use to
navigate to it?

The correct responses are:

Use go() to navigate to Pages, Location Groups, Wizards, and
Forwards.

Use push() to navigate to Popups and Exit Points.
Use goInWorkspace() to navigate to Worksheets.
